page.title: 18Changes within living memory
page.content: Chilton has seen many changes within living memory. In 1925 the village was really two separate places of Chilton and Windlestone. Two coal mines and a coke plant were working as was a blacksmith's. All these have since disappeared. In 1945 the mines were still working, Chilton had expanded and was almost a self-contained community with local shops of nearly every type. It had two picture houses and schools that ranged from infants to seniors. A level crossing carried a railway line across what was the A1 at Chilton. By the end of the 1960's the coal mines had shut down and working people had to find employment outside the village. More council houses had been built by this time but the cinemas were no longer in existence and the railway line had been dismantled.
